summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons Health Services clinical encounter record for Jeffrey Epstein, dated July 12, 2019, detailing a medical evaluation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It includes his medical history, current complaints (hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, back pain), physical exam findings, and prescribed medications. The record also contains an intake history and physical from July 9, 2019, documenting his social history, travel, and denial of abuse history.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the medical records, undergoing evaluation and treatment while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC NY).

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: The healthcare provider who conducted the intake history and physical examination of Epstein on July 9, 2019.

connections.description: Epstein was evaluated and treated by the MD for chronic conditions including hyperlipidemia, back pain, and sleep apnea.
Epstein underwent an intake medical history and physical examination conducted by the MLP upon entry to the correctional facility.

events.title: Intake Medical History and Physical
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein underwent a comprehensive intake medical examination at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, documenting his health history, social history, and travel.

events.title: Chronic Care Physician Evaluation
events.description: Epstein was seen for a chronic care evaluation for hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, and back pain. Medications were prescribed and adjusted based on his request.

events.description: An amendment was made to the clinical encounter note from July 12, 2019, by the MD.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC NY)
Mount Sinai Hospital (mentioned as site of past hospitalization)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC NY) under BOP register number 76318-054 at the time of these medical evaluations in July 2019.

Epstein's medical conditions documented include hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea (for which he used a CPAP machine brought at arrest), severe L4-L5 spinal issues causing shooting back pain, and constipation.
During his intake on July 9, 2019, Epstein reported extensive foreign travel, stating he had traveled to Paris for three weeks up until his arrest.
The intake social history noted Epstein reported having '10+' female sexual partners in the last 5 years, condom use 'sometimes', and a history of chlamydia in 2015.
Epstein denied any history of physical, emotional, or sexual abuse during the intake assessment.
